message_1:
What is the total number of distinguished second-order variables in the logical formula given below? 

((∀X)(∃Y)P(X,Y)) ∧ ((∃X)(∀Y) Q(X,Y)) ∨ (∃Z)R(Z) 

Note: Distinguished variables are those that are explicitly quantified.
message_2:
In the given logical formula, there are three distinguished second-order variables:

1. Y in (∀X)(∃Y)P(X,Y)
2. X in (∃X)(∀Y)Q(X,Y)
3. Y in (∃X)(∀Y)Q(X,Y)

So, the total number of distinguished second-order variables is 3.
